DTField.Name: LOADID
DTField.Label: LOADID
DTField.DTFieldHelp: Load reference number.

DTField.Name: CONSIGNEE
DTField.Label: CONSIGNEE
DTField.DTFieldHelp: The Client storing the Load.

DTField.Name: SKU
DTField.Label: SKU
DTField.DTFieldHelp: The SKU stored in the Load.

DTField.Name: LOADUOM
DTField.Label: LOADUOM
DTField.DTFieldHelp: The UOM of the inventory stored in the Load.

DTField.Name: LOCATION
DTField.Label: LOCATION
DTField.DTFieldHelp: The Location in which the Load is stored.

DTField.Name: UNITPRICE
DTField.Label: SKU Unit Price >=
DTField.DTFieldHelp: Add High cost/value to Payload Count (LCS)

DTField.Name: DESTINATIONLOCATION
DTField.Label: DESTINATIONLOCATION
DTField.DTFieldHelp: The Location to which the Load is to be moved (if the Load is in fact to be moved).

DTField.Name: STATUS
DTField.Label: STATUS
DTField.DTFieldHelp: Inventory status.

DTField.Name: ACTIVITYSTATUS
DTField.Label: ACTIVITYSTATUS
DTField.DTFieldHelp: The process the Load is currently under (e.g. picking, putaway, etc.).

DTField.Name: UNITS
DTField.Label: UNITS
DTField.DTFieldHelp: The number of units in the Load.

DTField.Name: UNITS4WALLINV
DTField.Label: UNITS4WALLINV
DTField.DTFieldHelp: The number of units of the SKU in the Load that exist in the whole warehouse.

DTField.Name: UNITSAVAILABLE
DTField.Label: UNITSAVAILABLE
DTField.DTFieldHelp: The number of inventory Units available in the Load.

DTField.Name: UNITSONHOLD
DTField.Label: UNITSONHOLD
DTField.DTFieldHelp: The number of Load units that are on hold.

DTField.Name: UNITSINLIMBO
DTField.Label: UNITSINLIMBO
DTField.DTFieldHelp: The number of Load units that are in LIMBO.

DTField.Name: UNITSALLOCATED
DTField.Label: UNITSALLOCATED
DTField.DTFieldHelp: The number of Load units that are allocated.

DTField.Name: UNITSINPROCESS
DTField.Label: UNITSINPROCESS
DTField.DTFieldHelp: The number of Load Units that are currently under process (e.g. picking, replenishment, etc.).

DTField.Name: UNITSPICKED
DTField.Label: UNITSPICKED
DTField.DTFieldHelp: The number of units picked from the Load.

DTField.Name: RECEIPT
DTField.Label: RECEIPT
DTField.DTFieldHelp: The Receipt Document according to which the Load was created.

DTField.Name: RECEIPTLINE
DTField.Label: RECEIPTLINE
DTField.DTFieldHelp: The Receipt Document Line according to which the Load was created.

DTField.Name: RECEIVEDATE
DTField.Label: RECEIVEDATE
DTField.DTFieldHelp: The date on which the Load was received.

DTField.Name: LASTSTATUSDATE
DTField.Label: LASTSTATUSDATE
DTField.DTFieldHelp: The date on which the Load status last changed.

DTField.Name: LASTMOVEDATE
DTField.Label: LASTMOVEDATE
DTField.DTFieldHelp: The date on which the Load was last moved.

DTField.Name: LASTCOUNTDATE
DTField.Label: LASTCOUNTDATE
DTField.DTFieldHelp: The date on which the Load was last counted.

DTField.Name: HOLDRC
DTField.Label: HOLDRC
DTField.DTFieldHelp: The code of the reason for which inventory was held.

DTField.Name: PRELIMBOSTATUS
DTField.Label: PRELIMBOSTATUS
DTField.DTFieldHelp: The status of the Load before it was in Limbo (incase it is in Limbo).

DTField.Name: PRELIMBOLOC
DTField.Label: PRELIMBOLOC
DTField.DTFieldHelp: The Location of the Load before it was in Limbo (incase it is in Limbo).

DTField.Name: ADDDATE
DTField.Label: ADDDATE
DTField.DTFieldHelp: The date on which data was added.

DTField.Name: ADDUSER
DTField.Label: ADDUSER
DTField.DTFieldHelp: The user who added the data.

DTField.Name: EDITDATE
DTField.Label: EDITDATE
DTField.DTFieldHelp: The date on which data was edited.

DTField.Name: EDITUSER
DTField.Label: EDITUSER
DTField.DTFieldHelp: The user who last edited the data.

DTField.Name: HandlingUnit
DTField.Label: HandlingUnit
DTField.DTFieldHelp: The ID of the container which is created (or which exists) in which the Load will be placed (used when Loads are created directly into containers).

DTField.Name: HandlingUnitType
DTField.Label: HandlingUnitType
DTField.DTFieldHelp: The type of the container which is created (or which exists) in which the Load will be placed (used when Loads are created directly into containers).
